creator: Hamilton Bonaduz AG
descriptionHtml: The ArcAir technology enables the online monitoring and visualization of pH, dissolved oxygen, viable cell density (VCD), conductivity and ORP sensors during biotechnological processes. With the ArcAir application, it is possible to communicate wirelessly with up to 30 Arc sensors at the same time parallel to the process control system interface when an Arc Wi Bluetooth adapter is connected between the VP head of an Arc sensor and the VP sensor cable.  Within the ArcAir application, Hamilton provides reporting and central data management of users, as well as validation reports for sensor calibration (excluding VCD sensors), verification, configuration and communication. ArcAir embeds report’s electronic signatures, enabling paperless workflow. All of this is in compliance with the GMP guidelines, such as FDA CFR21 Part 11 or Eudralex Volume 4 Annex 11.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
ArcAir 3.4 includes many new features and improvements. Compared to the previous software versions 3.2.0, ArcAir 3.4 includes:

• ArcAir Performance Improvements with Mobile Devices
• Supports Single Use VCD and Conductivity Arc sensors
• ArcAir General Improvements

Read the details in ArcAir Release Information (REF 10071124) at www.hamiltoncompany.com/arcair

title: ArcAir

creator: Hamilton Bonaduz AG
descriptionHtml: ArcAir technology enables the online monitoring and visualization of pH, dissolved oxygen, CO2, viable cell density (VCD), conductivity and ORP sensors during biotechnological processes. With the ArcAir application, it is possible to communicate wirelessly with up to 100 Arc sensors (Mobile version) at the same time parallel to the process control system interface when an Arc Wi Bluetooth adapter is connected between the VP head of an Arc sensor and the VP sensor cable, or the sensor has inbuilt Bluetooth functionality. Within the ArcAir application, Hamilton provides reporting and central data management of users, as well as validation reports for sensor calibration (excluding VCD sensors), verification, configuration and communication. ArcAir embeds report’s electronic signatures, enabling paperless workflow. All of this complies with the GMP guidelines, such as FDA CFR21 Part 11 or Eudralex Volume 4 Annex 11.

title: ArcAir

creator: Hamilton Bonaduz AG
descriptionHtml: ArcAir is the app for Hamilton Arc sensors. It enables online monitoring and visualization of pH, dissolved oxygen, CO2, cell density, conductivity, and ORP sensors during biotechnological processes. With the ArcAir application, you can communicate wirelessly with up to 100 Arc sensors at the same time parallel to the process control system interface when an Arc Wi Bluetooth adapter is connected between the VP head of an Arc sensor and the VP sensor cable or the sensor has inbuilt Bluetooth functionality. Within the ArcAir application, Hamilton provides reporting and central data management of users, as well as validation reports for sensor calibration (excluding VCD sensors), verification, configuration, and communication. ArcAir embeds report’s electronic signatures, enabling paperless workflow. All of this complies with the GMP guidelines such as FDA CFR21 Part 11 or Eudralex Volume 4 Annex 11.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
The key features introduced in this update include:
- Incyte Arc Integration - Enhancements and Improvements
- Dencytee Arc Integration - Updates and Advancements
- Operator Level S password improvement
- Advanced Handling for Sensors with the Same Measuring Point Name
- Compatibility for Upcoming Sensors
- Security Updates
- General Updates, Bug Fixes, and Improvements.
You can read all the details in ArcAir Release Information (REF 10071124), at www.hamiltoncompany.com/arcair

title: ArcAir
